metadata.title: CVE-2024-35935 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description: In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved: btrfs:send: handle path ref underflow in header iterate_inode_ref() Change BUG_ONto proper error handling if building the path buffer fails. The pointersare not printed so we don't accidentally leak kernel addresses.

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'ESM criteria, was needed').
